Main entry point: hubArchiveCreator.py¶

This Python file could be seen as the “main.py” file for HubArchiveCreator.

Galaxy will run this file when the user clicks on “Execute”.

hubArchiveCreator.configure_logger(extra_files_path=None, debug=False)[source]¶

Configure the logger depending on the option chosen: Dev or User.

It also configures the creation of a log file.

Parameters:
  • extra_files_path (string) – Path where all the outputs will be stored. Displayed in the HTML.
  • debug (bool) – Flag to configure the logger with extra debug messages or not.
hubArchiveCreator.configure_logger_dev(log_stdout=None)[source]¶
Dev Logger is defined as following:
  • Dev needs to have WARN, ERROR and CRITICAL but well formatted / without traceback, in stdout
  • Still access to full, brute and traceback in stderr for errors
  • And further access to debug if needed
hubArchiveCreator.configure_logger_stderr()[source]¶

Configure what should be logged in stderr. Nothing specific, but can be useful if needed.

hubArchiveCreator.configure_logger_user(log_stdout=None)[source]¶
User Logger is defined as following:
  • User needs to have WARN, ERROR and CRITICAL but well formatted / without traceback

    in STDOUT

  • Still access to full, brute and traceback for errors

    in STDERR

  • And further access to debug if needed

    in .log

Parameters:log_stdout (logging.StreamHandler) – StreamHandler to configure for user.
hubArchiveCreator.create_ordered_datatype_objects(ExtensionClass, array_inputs, inputs_data)[source]¶

Function which executes the creation all the necessary files/folders for a special Datatype, for TrackHub and update the dictionary of datatype

Parameters:
  • ExtensionClass (Datatype) –
  • array_inputs (list[string]) – Array of the false_path given by Galaxy. These paths are the location of the input files.
  • inputs_data (dict{FILE_PATH: dict{NAME: NAME_VALUE, EXTRA_DATA: EXTRA_DATA_VALUE}}]) – Dictionary containing the Galaxy false path as key, and the data as values
Returns:

An ordered dictionary of generic Datatype objects
Return type:

dict
hubArchiveCreator.main(argv)[source]¶

Entry of the program, receives all the parameter, via argparse, to begin the whole process of creating a UCSC TrackHub output.

Parameters:argv –
Returns:HTML document: Displays the structure of the Track Hub folder created
hubArchiveCreator.sanitize_name_input(string_to_sanitize)[source]¶

Sanitize the string passed in parameter by replacing ‘/’ and ‘ ‘ by ‘_’

Parameters:string_to_sanitize –
Return string:Sanitized string
Example: 
>>> sanitize_name_input('this/is an//example')
this_is_an__example
hubArchiveCreator.sanitize_name_inputs(inputs_data)[source]¶

Sanitize value of the keys “name” of the dictionary passed in parameter.

Because sometimes output from Galaxy, or even just file name, from user inputs, have spaces. Also, it can contain ‘/’ character and could break the use of os.path function.

Parameters:inputs_data – dict[string, dict[string, string]]
